Steps.StepString: Identified that one of the admin pages 'report' was vulnerable to an SQL injection from the 'id' parameter

Substeps.SubstepString: Recognize the SQL injection vulnerability in the 'id' parameter

Steps.StepString: Noticed that MySQL was being used
Decided to use a UNION SELECT based query to obtain information from MySQL special tables

Substeps.SubstepString: Make the decision to use a UNION SELECT based query
Plan to obtain information from MySQL special tables

Steps.StepString: Experienced difficulties finding the number of columns to use in the UNION SELECT due to browser extension issues

Substeps.SubstepString: Encounter difficulties determining the number of columns
Attribute the difficulties to browser extension issues

Steps.StepString: Used the group_concat() function to obtain all entries in a column as a single row

Substeps.SubstepString: Obtain all entries in a column as a single row

Steps.StepString: Ran a series of SQL queries via URL manipulation testing each column value

Substeps.SubstepString: Execute a SQL query via URL manipulation

Steps.StepString: Ran another series of SQL queries via URL manipulation to obtain table names from information_schema.tables

Substeps.SubstepString: Execute a SQL query via URL manipulation

Steps.StepString: Ran another series of SQL queries via URL manipulation to obtain column names from information_schema.columns

Substeps.SubstepString: Execute a SQL query via URL manipulation

Steps.StepString: Ran a final SQL query to retrieve the flag from the 'flag' column in the 'flag' table

Substeps.SubstepString: Retrieve the flag from the 'flag' column in the 'flag' table
